meanings.definition: The position or office of an abbot.
meanings.sent1: The abbotships in the monastery were highly respected.
meanings.sent2: He was appointed to the abbotships after years of dedicated service.
meanings.sent3: The abbotships were so prestigious that even the king admired them.
meanings.sent4: In the world of monks, abbotships were like crowns on their heads.
meanings.sent5: The abbotships symbolized leadership and wisdom in the religious community.

meanings.definition: The authority or jurisdiction of an abbot.
meanings.sent1: The abbotships allowed him to make important decisions for the monastery.
meanings.sent2: She respected the abbotships and followed the rules set by the abbot.
meanings.sent3: The abbotships gave him the power to banish mischievous monks to the garden.
meanings.sent4: His abbotships extended over the monks like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The abbotships granted him the right to lead and guide the monastery.
